function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Moderate negative correlation between temperature and COVID-19 cases and deaths","Impact":"Misinterpretation of temperature's effect on COVID-19 spread and potential lack of appropriate measures to mitigate transmission","Mitigation":"Conduct further research to understand the true impact of temperature on COVID-19 transmission, and consider additional factors that may influence spread","Technologies":"Data analysis and modeling tools to assess temperature's impact, and public health communication tools to educate on comprehensive transmission factors","People":"Public health officials, researchers, policymakers","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Negligible correlation between temperature and COVID-19 cases and deaths","Impact":"Relying solely on temperature as a factor in controlling COVID-19 spread, leading to inadequate measures","Mitigation":"Emphasize broader public health measures and factors affecting transmission, beyond just temperature","Technologies":"Data visualization tools to present comprehensive transmission factors, and public health education tools for disseminating multi-factorial information","People":"Public health officials, policymakers, general public","Owner":"Public health organizations, government health departments"},{"Description":"Reported impacts of humidity and temperature on COVID-19 transmission and mortality rate","Impact":"Misguided focus on temperature and humidity as primary factors in controlling COVID-19 spread, potentially neglecting other important measures","Mitigation":"Educate on a multi-factorial approach to COVID-19 transmission, highlighting the importance of various factors such as hygiene, social distancing, and vaccination","Technologies":"Public health communication tools for disseminating comprehensive information, and data analysis tools for assessing multi-factorial impacts on transmission","People":"Public health officials, researchers, policymakers, general public","Owner":"Government health organizations, public health institutions"}]}
